Name: Broken Down @ the Crossroads
Host(s): Hannah Hammons â€™29, Robert Patton â€™29, and Caden Pourier â€™29
Description: Do you ever miss small town radio? Do you ever miss the boredom and excitement that comes from watching the slow trails of traffic that drive by the local reservation radio truck? Broken Down @ the Crossroads, whose namesake is inspired by the keystone movie for native art and film â€œSmoke Signalsâ€, captures the grimy nostalgia of rural alternative culture, both old and new. Caden Pourier and Hannah Hammons will bring you the new sounds of underground hyperpop, while settling back with grunge and folk roots. Broken Down @ the Crossroads will occasionally host â€œLakota Hourâ€, where Pourier and guest-host Robert Patton will speak in Lakota to further language revitalization. Join Pourier and Hammons every week for playful banter and exciting tracks, broken down at the crossroads.

Welcome to Colonoscopy, where uncomfortable conversations get the examination they deserve. Every week on WebDCR, two commentators bring the takes and one probe brings the questions, diving into topics most shows are too scared to touch. Itâ€™s chaotic, itâ€™s insightful, and yes, the metaphor is intentional.

Tune in for expert banter, terrible opinions defended with confidence, and the kind of analysis that makes you say â€œI canâ€™t believe they just said that on air.â€
